page.title: 02ULLESKELF
page.content: ULLESKELF IS THE LARGEST VILLAGE IN THE AREA. THE EASTERN EDGE OF OUR AREA DIVIDES THE VILLAGE. WITHIN OUR AREA THERE IS A SMALL VILLAGE SCHOOL, A METHODIST CHURCH, A PUBLIC HOUSE, A GARAGE, A SMALL COUNCIL ESTATE AND A SMALL ESTATE OF NEW BUNGALOWS. THE MAIN RAILWAY LINE BETWEEN LONDON AND EDINBURGH PASSES THROUGH THE VILLAGE. EXPRESS TRAINS DO NOT STOP. THERE IS A LOCAL SERVICE BETWEEN YORK AND SHEFFIELD. THE STATION BUILDINGS AND YARD ARE USED AS A DEPOT BY A WHOLESALE FLORIST. THERE IS A BUS SERVICE PASSING THROUGH THE VILLAGE, LINKING IT WITH TADCASTER AND PONTEFRACT. THERE IS A SMALL PRIVATE BUS COMPANY NEAR TO THE VILLAGE. THERE IS A POLICE STATION
